current_task: Native app Phase 1 complete + documentation workflow established

in_response_to.acknowledged: MusicBrainz stack fully operational - Solr + live indexer running

message: Phase 1 of native app is complete. IMPORTANT: We now have 4 authoritative documents in the repo that BOTH Claudes must follow as source of truth.

documentation_workflow.location: doc/ directory in repo (access via git pull)

documents.purpose: AI persona for Apple/Swift development - coding standards, priorities, defaults
documents.relevance_to_claude2: LOW - primarily for native app work on Mac

documents.purpose: 5-phase plan for Swift/SwiftUI native app migration
documents.relevance_to_claude2: MEDIUM - native app will query stonefrog-db01 APIs
MEDIUM - affects web app deployed on stonefrog-db01

documents.purpose: Learning resources for Apple platform development

how_to_access: 3. These docs are checked into repo, always available after git pull
workflow_rules: Check relevant docs BEFORE answering questions about architecture/features
Flag any mismatches between docs and actual implementation
Propose doc patches if you discover something docs don't cover
CLAUDE.md remains the primary project reference - these docs supplement it

api_discovery.issue: MusicBrainz artist search sometimes returns artists without 'type' field
api_discovery.solution: Made type optional (ArtistType?) in Swift model

next_steps: Create Xcode project for full app bundle (Mac side)
Test on macOS and iOS Simulator (Mac side)
Phase 2: Core UI - artist detail view, favorites (Mac side)
notes: The native app hits the same /api/musicbrainz endpoints on stonefrog-db01 that the web app uses. No server-side changes needed for Phase 1. Thanks for getting the MusicBrainz stack production-ready!
